content:
Check:
  any:
    # Fire query if domain name does not start with APFA and does not have the format "AP" followed by an alpha character, then an alphanum character
    - all:
        - name: DOMAIN
          operator: not_prefix_matches_regex
          prefix: 4
          value: ^APFA$
        - name: DOMAIN
          operator: not_matches_regex
          value: ^AP[A-Z][A-Z0-9]$
    # Fire query if domain name starts with APFA and is not followed by an alpha character, then an alphanum character
    - all:
        - name: DOMAIN
          operator: prefix_matches_regex
          prefix: 4
          value: ^APFA$
        - name: DOMAIN
          operator: not_suffix_matches_regex
          suffix: 2
          value: '[A-Z0-9][A-Z0-9]$'
    # Fire query if characters 3/4 refers to invalid SDTM domain
    - name: DOMAIN
      operator: matches_regex
      value: ^AP(AD|AX|AP|SQ|SA)$
    # Fire query if characters 5/6 refers to invalid SDTM domain (for APFA domains)
    - name: DOMAIN
      operator: matches_regex
      value: ^APFA(AD|AX|AP|SQ|SA)$
Core:
  Id: CDISC.SDTMIG.CG0663
  Version: '1'
  Status: Draft
Description: Raise an error when an AP Core Domain does not have a value length of
  4 characters beginning with 'AP' and ending with 2 character SDTM domain
Outcome:
  Message: AP Core Domain does not have a value length of 4 characters beginning with
    'AP' and ending with 2 character SDTM domain
Rule Type: Record Data
Sensitivity: Variable
Authorities:
  - Organization: CDISC
    Standards:
      - Name: SDTMIG
        Version: '3.4'
        References:
          - Origin: SDTM and SDTMIG Conformance Rules
            Rule Identifier:
              Id: CG0663
              Version: '1'
            Version: '2.0'
            Citations:
              - Cited Guidance: Associated Persons datasets are given a prefix of
                  AP-- to identify the data as AP data to and distinguish them from
                  study subject data. Associated Persons domain codes in the DOMAIN
                  column of every record are also given a prefix of AP-- to identify
                  the domains as AP domains and to distinguish them from study subject
                  domains. AP domain codes are therefore four characters long.
                Document: AP Guide v1.0
                Section: Section 2
Scope:
  Classes:
    Include:
      - ALL
  Domains:
    Include:
      - AP--
    Exclude:
      - APRELSUB
      - SUPP--
      - POOLDEF

json.Description: Raise an error when an AP Core Domain does not have a value length of 4 characters beginning with 'AP' and ending with 2 character SDTM domain

Outcome.Message: AP Core Domain does not have a value length of 4 characters beginning with 'AP' and ending with 2 character SDTM domain

Citations.Cited_Guidance: Associated Persons datasets are given a prefix of AP-- to identify the data as AP data to and distinguish them from study subject data. Associated Persons domain codes in the DOMAIN column of every record are also given a prefix of AP-- to identify the domains as AP domains and to distinguish them from study subject domains. AP domain codes are therefore four characters long.
